items.title: NSW's gun and protest laws have been tightened after the Bondi terror attack. Here's what you need to know
items.description: The Minns government recalls state parliament to pass stricter new laws following the shooting at Bondi Beach that killed 15 people.

items.title: 'Christmas will feel different this year': PM strikes sombre seasonal tone
items.description: Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Sussan Ley are urging Australians to "stand together" this Christmas in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Council to shut down prayer hall linked to notorious preacher
items.description: The City of Canterbury Bankstown Council says the site had been approved for use as a medical centre.

items.title: Epstein files email show 'A' at 'Balmoral' sought 'inappropriate friends'
items.description: Someone who referred to themselves as "A" at "Balmoral" emailed convicted child sex offender Ghislaine Maxwell in 2001 asking if she had found them "some new inappropriate friends", the latest Epstein files document dump has revealed.

items.title: Former federal Liberal MP Katie Allen dies aged 59
items.description: Former federal Liberal MP Katie Allen has died aged 59, after developing a rare form of cancer, her family has announced.

items.title: What the weather will bring in your capital city on Christmas Day
items.description: It is just a few sleeps until Christmas Day, and the weather is promising a mixed bag for Australia's capital cities. Here is what to expect.

items.title: Australians tipped to spend record $1.6b on Boxing Day sales
items.description: Boxing Day spending is expected to hit a record high, supported by revived household spending after three interest rate cuts.

items.title: Live: ASX to fall as Wall Street, gold and silver jump to record highs
items.description: The Australian share market is likely to fall in morning trade ahead of the latest ABS inflation data, while the Nasdaq rises above 17,000 points for the first time ever. Follow live.

items.title: Russell Brand charged with another two sex offences including rape
items.description: The British comedian now faces seven charges of sexual assault involving six separate women.

items.title: Trump wants the US to lead on 6G. Here's when Australia could get it
items.description: Donald Trump says he wants the United States to lead the world in the "6G race" and has given his government one year to find out how to begin making it happen.

items.title: Christmas festivities return to Bethlehem after two years as Palestinians hope for a 'better future'
items.description: For the first time in two years, Bethlehem has restarted its Christmas festivities to "reignite the spirit that everybody needs" while Palestinians continue to live under restrictions.

items.title: Six illicit tobacco operators rack up millions of dollars in unpaid fines
items.description: Illicit tobacco retailers have racked up millions in unpaid fines since the introduction of stronger penalties in Queensland, with one owing more than $7 million.

items.title: Australian businessman held without charge in Vietnamese jail
items.description: A high-flying Australian financier accused of swindling a struggling Vietnamese petroleum trading company has been languishing in a Ho Chi Minh City cell for two months.

items.title: Woman accused of trying to kill ex allegedly searched for 'hit men'
items.description: A woman accused of trying to murder her ex-husband before fleeing to Palau has made a bid in South Australia's Supreme Court for release on bail.

items.title: Quiz: Do you know how to make the gravy? Test your Christmas song knowledge
items.description: Which Christmas hits didn't do as well on the charts as you'd think? Test your knowledge of festive cheer.

items.title: 'She Trapped the Sun': Inside the world's first solar house
items.description: On December 24, 1948, a family of Hungarian refugees moved into a small house in Dover, Massachusetts.  But there was a catch.

items.title: Christmas boom on hold as berries, cherries ripen too late
items.description: Christmas is usually a boom time for Tasmanian berry producers, but this year's cold spring has slowed crops and hurt profits.

items.title: CommBank customers to receive $68m in refunds for incorrect bank fees
items.description: The Commonwealth Bank of Australia will refund low-income earners receiving Centrelink payments approximately $68 million in unfair fees — just over a quarter of what was charged.

items.title: Up to 1,700 jobs axed as major security firm collapses
items.description: A "significant number" of employees have been made immediately redundant as MA Security — which provides security and maintenance services to major retailers like Coles, Kmart and Amazon — enters administration.

items.title: 150-year-old newspaper with a 95yo editor gets new owner
items.description: The Buloke Times, the "heartbeat of the community", has a new owner after being in one family's hands for more than a century.

items.title: Australia names Boxing Day Ashes replacements for Cummins and Lyon
items.description: West Australian fast bowler Jhye Richardson comes into Australia's squad for the fourth Ashes Test, while Victorian off spinner Todd Murphy has been named, and is a chance to play his eighth match and first on Australian soil.

items.title: England to investigate Duckett video as Noosa investigation looms
items.description: ECB managing director Rob Key will investigate reports England's recent break in Noosa resembled a "stag do" as the tourists pick up the pieces from their Ashes defeat.

items.title: 'Belittling of women's tennis': New 'Battle of the Sexes' a lose-lose
items.description: Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kygrios's match marketed under the "Battle of the Sexes" banner makes a mockery of first era-defining match between Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs.

items.title: Trump sparks Denmark's anger by appointing US envoy to Greenland
items.description: US President Donald Trump appoints a special envoy to Greenland, drawing renewed criticism from Denmark and the territory's leader over Washington's interest in the mineral-rich Arctic island.

items.title: Pill version of injectable weight-loss drug Wegovy approved by US regulator
items.description: A daily weight-loss pill will soon be available in the US, after the regulator gave approval to Danish drug company Novo Nordisk's oral version of the popular injectable, Wegovy.
